backend/architecture.title: Architecture
backend/architecture.description: The backend is a RESTful API built with Node.js and Express, written in TypeScript. It follows a Service-Controller pattern to separate concerns and ensure maintainability.

backend/database.title: Database Schema
backend/database.description: The application uses PostgreSQL as the primary relational database. Below is the comprehensive Entity-Relationship (ER) Diagram representing the full data structure.

backend/setup.title: Setup & Installation
backend/setup.description: This guide covers the setup process for the Node.js backend server. You can run the backend either entirely via Docker or manually for development.

deployment.title: Deployment Guide
deployment.description: This guide explains how to deploy the Rituals App backend server. It covers both Local Development Hosting (for testing with friends) and Cloud Deployment (for production).

features/ai-assistant.title: AI Assistant
features/ai-assistant.description: The Rituals App features an intelligent AI Assistant powered by OpenAI GPT-4, designed to act as a personal habit coach.

features/analytics.title: Analytics
features/analytics.description: Understanding your progress is key to long-term habit retention. The Analytics module provides visual insights into your performance.

features/authentication.title: Authentication
features/authentication.description: The Rituals App uses a secure authentication system to manage user identities and sessions.

features/gamification.title: Gamification System
features/gamification.description: The Rituals App uses a robust gamification system to keep users motivated and engaged. This system includes Experience Points (XP), Levels, Coins, Badges, Streaks, and Freezes.

features/notifications.title: Push Notifications
features/notifications.description: Notifications are crucial for habit formation. The Rituals App uses Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM) for reliable push notifications across all platforms.

features/onboarding.title: Onboarding Flow
features/onboarding.description: The Onboarding Flow provides a seamless introduction for new users, guiding them through the app's core features and helping them create their first ritual.

features/profile.title: Profile & Settings
features/profile.description: The Profile section allows users to manage their identity, preferences, account security, and premium subscription.

features/rituals.title: Rituals Management
features/rituals.description: Rituals are the core unit of the application. A "Ritual" represents a habit or task that a user wants to perform regularly.

features/social.title: Social & Community
features/social.description: Building habits is easier when you're not alone. The Rituals App includes comprehensive social features to foster accountability and friendly competition.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Rituals App is a comprehensive habit-tracking and social gamification platform designed to help users build better habits through social accountability and game-like mechanics.

mobile/architecture.title: Architecture
mobile/architecture.description: The mobile application is built using Flutter and follows a Feature-First architecture with Riverpod for state management. This approach ensures scalability by grouping code by domain (what it does) rather than layer (what it is).

mobile/setup.title: Setup & Installation
mobile/setup.description: This guide covers the complete setup process for the Flutter mobile application.

mobile/user-flows.title: User Flows
mobile/user-flows.description: This document outlines the primary user journeys within the Rituals App.

roadmap.title: Roadmap
roadmap.description: This document outlines the development progress and future plans for the Rituals App.
